text: <@UCYRPLTGR> $welcome

<!here> Meetup tomorrow will be open for community discussion and questions.  Please let us know if you have topics that you would like to include!  We are planning to review/close open issues.
Hi all.... so way back in Feb I attempted a UX 'feature' test...  I'm about to go revisit that and get my brain back into DRP
I've got a 'hall pass' for the rest of the year (I think) and a pile of HP, Dell DC gear... was thinking I'll attempt to tie the 'new' auto-doc into a drp-sematic CI-CD UX checker...
Time to feed the :bear:!
I'm thinking the most 'useful' thing to attempt is to 'UX' script Rob's KRIB demo pulling the semantic hooks in the KRIB docs to drive the UI... but open to suggestions.

<!here> hey guys, is it possible to use drpcli remotely ? I'm trying this but it doesn't seem to work:
`/drpcli -d -E <http://drp.ne1-l01r00-mgmt1.ubisoft.org:8091/> info status`
yep definitely works. Not sure you need to specify the port if youâ€™re using the default
I must have missed something. I got a `BAD GATEWAY` error.
<@U8FAN7PLK> - port 8091 is (usually) the HTTP file server - port 8092 would be the (normally) API port
along w/ `https` protocol

so:
`drpcli -d -E <https://drp.ne1-l01r00-mgmt1.ubisoft.org:8092> info get`
(do not add a trailing slash to the URL reference)
also - remember user/pass needs to be specified if you are not using the default `rocketskates` and default PW
(`-U username -P password` ... or you can generate a token and use the token `-T token`)
It's working but it's slow, not sure why though.
Thanks for the help :slightly_smiling_face:
initial request might be slow - we cache token/credentials after first look up - how do things look after first ?
same
Ok - can you quantify "slow" - my API performance hitting a DRP endpoint from client in California to an Endpoint in New Jersey is pretty darned quick ...
at least 30 -40s for a `drpcli info status` :slightly_smiling_face:
ah - info status will take a bit of time - as it's doing "health checking" of the services - I'm not sure if that's "normal" for info status, let me check mine
that API call kicks off a series of checks on the health of the ports/services
so - for my Endpoint - 15-ish seconds seems "normal"
let me try another command
another example on my side:  `drpcli machines list` (which includes 8 machines, and the gohai inventory data chunks ... ) take around 0.7s real time for full round trip
pretty fast indeed
looks like I picked just the wrong test
you can also use slim to send smaller models
